verses.text: FANONGO ki he me‘a ni, ‘a e kau taula‘eiki; pea mou tokanga, ‘a e fale ‘o ‘Isileli, pea mou fokotu‘u telinga mai, ‘a e fale ‘o e tu‘i; he ko homou fakamaau ‘oku tala; he kuo mou hoko ko e helepuna ‘i Mīsipa, mo e kupenga kuo ‘a‘au ‘i funga Tepoa.
Pea ‘i he fakamafola angahala kuo nau keli mama‘o; ka ko e tautea au kiate kinautolu kotoa.
‘Oku ou ‘ilo ‘e au ‘a ‘Ifalemi, pea ‘oku ‘ikai puli ‘a ‘Isileli meiate au: he ko koe ena, ‘Ifalemi, kuo ke taukave ‘a e fe‘auaki; ko ‘Isileli kuo ‘uli‘i.
‘Oku ‘ikai tuku ‘e he‘enau ngaahi fai anga ke nau tafoki ki he ‘Otua; he ‘oku ‘i honau loto ha laumālie anga fe‘auaki, pea ‘oku ‘ikai te nau ‘ilo ‘a Sihova.
Ko ia, ‘e mātu‘aki talatalaaki‘i ia ‘e he lāngilangi ‘o ‘Isileli: pea ko ‘Isileli mo ‘Ifalemi te na humu ‘i he‘ena fai kovi; ‘e humu foki ‘i Siuta fakataha mo kinaua.
Neongo ‘enau ‘alu ‘aki ‘enau fanga sipi mo kosi, mo ‘enau fanga pulu, ‘enau kumi kia Sihova, ka ‘e ‘ikai te nau ‘ilo ia: kuo ne motu meiate kinautolu.
Kuo nau fai kākā kia Sihova; he kuo nau fanau‘i ha fānau muli: ko e taimi ni ‘e keina kinautolu mo honau ngaahi tofi‘a ‘e he fakamāhina fo‘ou.
Ifi koaneti ‘i Kipea, ifi talupite ‘i Lama; fākaulu ‘i Pete-‘āveni “Penisi-mani, kilo ki tu‘a.”
‘E hoko ‘a ‘Ifalemi ko e fonua ‘auha ‘i he ‘aho ‘o e tautea: kuo u fakahā ‘i he ngaahi matakali ‘o ‘Isileli ‘a e me‘a kuo pau.
Kuo hoko ‘a e hou‘eiki Siuta ‘o hangē ko e fa‘ahinga hiki kau‘ā: te u huhua ‘eku ‘ita kiate kinautolu ‘o hangē ko e vai.
Ko e fakamālohia ‘a ‘Ifalemi, ko e laikina ‘i he fakamaau; koe‘uhi na‘a ne loto ke muimui ki he tu‘utu‘uni.
Ko ia, ‘oku ou hangē ko ha mū ki ‘Ifalemi, pea hangē ko ha tunga ki he fale ‘o Siuta.

Pea ‘i he vakai ‘e ‘Ifalemi hono mahaki, pea mo Siuta hono pala, na‘e ‘alu ‘a ‘Ifalemi ki ‘Āsilia, ‘o ‘alu ‘ene fekau ki he Tu‘i Taukapo: ka ‘oku ‘ikai te ne lava ‘e ia ke faito‘o kimoua, pea ‘oku ‘ikai te ne mateka‘i atu ‘a e pala.
He te u hoko hangē ha laione ki ‘Ifalemi, pea hangē ko e manu hau ki he fale ‘o Siuta: ko au, ‘io, ko au te u hae ‘o ‘alu; te u ‘ave, pea ‘oku ‘ikai ha hamusi.
Te u ‘alu, ‘o fou ki hoku potu, kae‘oua ke nau ongo‘i halaia, ‘o kumi ki hoku mata: ka hoko ha mamahi kiate kinautolu, te nau kumi vave kiate au.
